result.execSummary:
The defendant De'Arro M. S. McKenzie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. De'Arro M. S. McKenzie is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • De'Arro M. S. McKenzie was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 93 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.
Do not reside with any person in any place in which children reside other than biological child.  Not to physically discipline any children.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the Deft.

supervisions.notes:
PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.
**AS OF COURT HEARING ON 7/24/17 JUDGMENT IS VACATED.  DEFT IS RESENTENCED.

rcv'd from Amber Parenteau - requesting a vacating order - clerk called and left message explaining that there is no vacating order and that the Amended JOC dated 7/25/17 is stemming from a letter rcv'd from DOC on 6/7/17  requesting the Court review the sentence; new sentencing hearing held on 7/24/17 at which time the Judge found the sentence from 3/24/17 to be unlawful and a new sentence was imposed.  kmk

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody pro se.  Previous sentence is vacated; was an unlawful sentence.  Deft sentenced to 15mos WSP initial confinement followed by 6mos of ES.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Credit for 289 days commencing from today.
Further proceedings on July 24, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
from Gabriel Gorske (Dodge Corr) requesting the court review the JOC dated 3/27/17 for count 2

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Kristyne Watson.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 21mos WSP; initial confinement of 18mos followed by 3mos of ES.  ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  Credit for 167 days.  Appeal rights.
Kristyne Watson  kmk
revoc summary
Ct.1 - Dismissed  kmk
Amended
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge  kmk
deft placed on probation

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Hilary Edwards.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance; statement given by victim's mother.  Amended information filed.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1 (as amended).  Admits to repeater.  Plea colliquey interrupted; present charge does not fit the circumstances.  Court takes a short recess to allow defense counsel to confer with her client.  Court reconvenes.  Defense counsel reports the deft will w/draw his plea to count 1 & enter plea to count 2.  Colliquey conducted with deft; deft states he wishes to withdraw his plea on count 1 and enter a plea to count 2.  Motion granted by the Court.  Deft pleads guilty to count 2; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Count 1 is dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  If revoked, credit for 93 days is requested.
filed by Atty. Hilary Edwards  kmk
Hilary Edwards  kmk

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Atty Rocco DeFilippis appeared on behalf of Atty Carmen Ayres.  Deft not transported from the KCJ.  Defense requests a short adjournment in order for new counsel to be appointed to the deft's case; Atty Ayres has departed the PD's office.  No objection by the State.
